title: Offshore wind target of 1,400GW by 2050 ‘could save $1.88 trillion in public health costs’
lead: The goal is achievable if governments work together with industry to set out stable policies and pipeline visibility, according to a new report

title: UK competition watchdog launches market study into EV charging sector
lead: It is considering how to ensure the sector works well for consumers now and in the future, which will help to build trust in the service and address any competition issues

title: Pozitive Energy is sponsoring TELCA’s Consultancy of the Year – and here’s the shortlist…
lead: This year, our industry-recognised awards show is taking place online on the 11th of December

title: Welsh Government unveils £30m EV charging strategy
lead: Over the next decade, the plan identifies the need for between 30,000 and 50,000 fast chargers and 2,000 to 3,5000 rapid or ultra-rapid chargers

title: Yorkshire Energy becomes latest supplier to go bust
lead: Ofgem will now choose a new supplier to take on Yorkshire Energy’s 74,000 domestic customers and a small number of business customers

title: 5G networks ‘can be up to 90% greener than 4G systems’
lead: Nokia and Telefónica note as data traffic exponentially rises, 5G networks will need to be equipped with a number of sustainable hardware and software features to keep related emissions as low as possible

title: Raft of energy firms sign up to improve disability-related diversity
lead: DTEK, EDF Energy, ENEOS Holdings and PSEG are among the businesses that have joined the Valuable 500

title: Crown Estate seeks input on achieving 1GW of floating offshore wind by 2030
lead: It is currently inviting views on the scale of the opportunity for floating wind in the UK and the likely pipeline of projects between now and 2030

title: New York adopts new regulations to reduce power sector emissions
lead: It will ensure regional emissions are 65% below the baseline by 2030

title: Government launches search for locations to home prototype fusion energy plant
lead: The Spherical Tokamak for Energy Production project is targeted for completion by 2040 and will be delivered through the UK Atomic Energy Authority
